<<<<<<< SEARCH
  /**
   * Helper function to calculate an object's priority (H-value).
   *
   * From the original code: pri = L + (freq * 1.0e6 / size)
   * The 1.0e6 is a scaling factor to keep the (freq/size)
   * component significant.
   * 
   * This variant uses a piecewise scaling:
   * - For objects > 1MB, emphasize frequency and penalize size (use log2(freq+1) / log2(size+2))
   * - For objects <= 4KB, strongly boost frequency (freq^1.2 / sqrt(size+1))
   * - Otherwise, use hybrid: (freq+1) / (size^0.75)
   */
  double calculate_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
    constexpr double L1 = 1.0e5, L2 = 4.0e5, L3 = 2.0e5;
    if (size == 0) return pri_last_evict + freq * L1; // degenerate case
    
    if (size > 1024*1024) {
      // Very large objects: bias towards frequency but penalize size more
      return pri_last_evict + std::log2(freq + 1.0) * L2 / std::log2(size + 2.0);
    } else if (size <= 4096) {
      // Very small objects: boost for freq, less penalty for size
      return pri_last_evict + std::pow(freq + 1.0, 1.2) * L3 / std::sqrt(size + 1.0);
    } else {
      // Hybrid for the rest
      return pri_last_evict + (freq + 1.0) * L1 / std::pow(size, 0.75);
    }
  }
=======
  /**
   * Helper function to calculate an object's priority (H-value).
   *
   * This enhanced variant applies adaptive, sublinear scaling to size and log-bias for frequency
   * to better balance small/medium/large objects and prevent overpromotion of tiny items,
   * while ensuring large-but-hot objects survive longer.
   *
   * - For objects > 1MB: strong log-bias, heavier size penalty
   * - For objects <= 4KB: mild freq boost but not superlinear
   * - For others: sublinear freq & size
   */
  double calculate_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
    constexpr double L1 = 1.2e5, L2 = 3.2e5, L3 = 1.3e5;
    if (size == 0) return pri_last_evict + std::log2(freq+2) * L1;

    if (size > 1024*1024) {
      // Very large: log-based freq, heavier penalty on size (1.12)
      return pri_last_evict + std::log2(freq+2.0) * L2 / std::pow(size + 8.0, 1.12);
    } else if (size <= 4096) {
      // Small objects: mild frequency boost (freq+1.5)^1.09, gentle size penalty
      return pri_last_evict + std::pow(freq + 1.5, 1.09) * L3 / std::pow(size+1.0, 0.57);
    } else {
      // Hybrid for the rest: sublinear freq and size
      return pri_last_evict + std::pow(freq + 1.0, 1.04) * L1 / std::pow(size+2.0, 0.76);
    }
  }

    // Piecewise "insertion bonus" for certain object sizes:
    // - Large objects get a virtual freq boost (but not too much)
    // - Small objects get a slightly higher virtual freq
    uint64_t adj_freq = new_obj.frequency;
    if (obj_size > 1024 * 1024) adj_freq += 3;
    else if (obj_size <= 4096) adj_freq += 2;
    else if (obj_size <= 65536) adj_freq += 1;

    double pri = calculate_priority(adj_freq, new_obj.size);
    PQNode new_node(pri, ++request_counter, obj_id);
    auto [set_iter, inserted] = priority_queue.insert(new_node);

    new_obj.pq_iterator = set_iter;
    cache_objects[obj_id] = new_obj;
